summary_points: 1. Victor L. Crawford, Hershey Company's Lead Independent Director, will not stand for re-election at the 2025 Annual Meeting of Stockholders (expected May 6, 2025), but will continue serving until then; his departure is not due to any disagreement with the company.
2. The Hershey Company filed a Form 8-K Current Report on March 7, 2025, with the SEC,  simultaneously satisfying their filing obligations.
3.  No specific future impacts or risks were mentioned in this section of the filing.
1. CSX Corp announced a public offering of $600,000,000 of 5.050% Notes due 2035 on March 6, 2025, closing is expected on March 10, 2025.
2.  The notes were offered at a purchase price of 99.089% of the principal amount, plus accrued interest from March 10, 2025.
3. The Underwriting Agreement includes customary indemnification clauses between CSX Corp and the Underwriters for certain liabilities.
1. On March 7, 2025, Ameren Corporation issued and sold $750 million in 5.375% Senior Notes due 2035, receiving net proceeds of approximately $743.8 million before expenses.
2. The offering involved five joint book-running managers and three co-managers.

3.  The Underwriting Agreement includes extensive representations and warranties from Ameren Corporation regarding its financial health and legal compliance, as of February 27, 2025 and March 7, 2025.
1. Axon Enterprise, Inc. exchanged approximately $407.5 million of its 0.50% convertible senior notes due 2027 for cash and approximately 1 million shares of common stock, as of March 6, 2025.
2.  Following the exchange, approximately $282.5 million of notes will remain outstanding.
3. Hedged holders' unwinding of hedge positions could substantially impact Axon's common stock market price, although the magnitude and effect are unpredictable.

1. On March 7, 2025, Philip Morris International Inc. announced that a Canadian court approved a plan to resolve all tobacco product-related claims and litigation against its Canadian affiliate and itself.
2. The approved plan involves a CAD 32.5 billion (approximately USD 22.7 billion) aggregate settlement among RBH, ITL, and JTIM, with RBH retaining approximately USD 525 million.

3.  Following implementation of the plan (expected in 2025), RBH is expected to remain deconsolidated under U.S. GAAP, and any dividends from RBH derived from net after-tax income are expected to be incremental to PMI’s operating cash flow and adjusted diluted EPS.
1. TransDigm Group Incorporated held its 2025 Annual Meeting of Shareholders on March 6, 2025, where all ten director nominees were re-elected.
2.  While most director elections received over 45 million "FOR" votes, one received significantly fewer (Gary E. McCullough with 45,784,948 "FOR" votes).
3. Ernst & Young LLP was ratified as the Company's independent registered public accounting firm for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2025, with 51,164,969 votes in favor.

1. On March 4, 2025, Fortive Corp appointed Mark Okerstrom as Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer, effective March 24, 2025, replacing Charles McLaughlin who will retire but assist with the transition until December 31, 2025.
2.  Mr. Okerstrom's compensation package includes an $800,000 annual base salary, a target bonus of 125% of base salary, and a total of $12.5 million in one-time sign-on awards (cash and equity).
3. A portion of Mr. Okerstrom's one-time sign-on awards is intended to compensate him for potential lost compensation from his prior position.
1. Smurfit Westrock's net income decreased significantly to $319 million in 2024 from $825 million in 2023, largely due to merger-related expenses and increased interest expense.
2.  A material weakness was identified in Smurfit Westrock's internal control over financial reporting as of December 31, 2024.
3. Smurfit Westrock anticipates $135 million in pension plan contributions and benefit payments in 2025.
1. As of March 6th, 2025, News Corp had repurchased approximately US$645,124,998.53 worth of Class A and Class B shares under its US$1 billion stock repurchase program.
2. On March 6th, 2025,  News Corp repurchased a total of 31,597,684 shares (21,158,235 Class A and 10,439,449 Class B), paying between US$14.88 and US$35.25 per share.

3. News Corp's stock repurchase program, authorized to acquire up to $1 billion in outstanding shares, carries future risks stemming from market conditions, market price fluctuations, and alternative investment opportunities.
1. Walgreens Boots Alliance (WBA) will be acquired by Sycamore Partners for a price ranging from $14.45 to $17.45 per share, closing by the end of 2025.
2. The $11.45 cash component of the acquisition represented a 29% premium to WBA's December 9, 2024 share price.
3.  The acquisition includes a contingent value right (CVR) of up to $3.00 per share, dependent on the future value of WBA's VillageMD holdings.
1. On March 6, 2025, Principal Financial Group, Inc. completed a private placement of $500,000,000 in Pre-Capitalized Trust Securities (P-Caps) due February 15, 2055.

2.  The company has the right to issue up to an additional $500,000,000 in 5.807% Senior Notes due 2055, with the obligation triggered by certain events, including a drop in stockholders' equity below $4 billion (potentially adjusted).
3.  The company will pay a facility fee of 1.289% per annum on the maximum potential principal amount of Senior Notes issued, starting August 15, 2025.
1. On March 6, 2025, PayPal Holdings, Inc. issued and sold $1.5 billion in senior notes, comprised of floating rate notes due 2028, 4.450% notes due 2028, and 5.100% notes due 2035.
2.  The issuance of the notes included covenants limiting PayPal's ability to create liens on certain properties and restricting mergers and acquisitions,  subject to specified exceptions.

3.  If a change of control occurs at PayPal and a subsequent downgrade to below investment grade rating by Fitch, S&P, and Moody’s within a defined period, PayPal will be required to offer to repurchase any outstanding notes of that series at 101% of the principal amount plus accrued interest.
